method.name: Ameva Discretizer

reference.ref: L. Gonzalez-Abril, F.J. Cuberos, F. Velasco, J.A. Ortega. Ameva: An autonomous discretization algorithm. Expert Systems with Applications 36 (2009) 5327-5332.

generalDescription.objective: To transform a set of numerical variables into nominal variables. Input variables may be either real or integer.
generalDescription.howWork:
Ameva Discretizer is an algorithm that discretizes the non nominal attributes (real or integer) of a group of instances.
The task of a discretization algorithm is to build a set of intervals for each non nominal attribute. The value of the attribute is translated to the interval number to which the value belongs.
Ameva Discretizer is a method for supervised discretization. Initially there are no cut points selected. The process is iterative adding cut points chosen as the Ameva measure is minimized until the stop criterion is reached.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Ameva Discretizer Dataset: Iris Plants
Input Training set: iris-10-1tra.dat Input Test set: iris-10-1tst.dat Output Training set: Ameva-D.iris-10-1tra.dat Output Test set: Ameva-D.iris-10-1tst.dat Descriptor: result1e0.txt
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/Ameva-D.iris folder the discretization results; 3 files are generated in this folder:
File Ameva-D.iris-10-1tra.dat: It contains the discretization result of training set.
@relation iris @attribute sepalLength {0,1,2} @attribute sepalWidth {0,1,2} @attribute petalLength {0,1,2} @attribute petalWidth {0,1,2} @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,0,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa ... 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,2,1,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 0,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 0,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 0,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor ... 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,2,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 1,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 1,0,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,0,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 1,2,2,2,Iris-virginica 1,1,2,2,Iris-virginica
File Ameva-D.iris-10-1tst.dat: It contains the discretization result of testing set.
@relation iris @attribute sepalLength {0,1,2} @attribute sepalWidth {0,1,2} @attribute petalLength {0,1,2} @attribute petalWidth {0,1,2} @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 2,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,0,2,1,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,2,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 2,0,2,2,Iris-virginica 1,0,2,1,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica 1,0,2,2,Iris-virginica
File result1e0.txt: It contains the descriptor of cutting points used in the discretization.
Cut point 0 of attribute 0 : 5.45 Cut point 1 of attribute 0 : 6.25 Number of cut points of attribute 0 : 2 Cut point 0 of attribute 1 : 2.95 Cut point 1 of attribute 1 : 3.3499999999999996 Number of cut points of attribute 1 : 2 Cut point 0 of attribute 2 : 2.45 Cut point 1 of attribute 2 : 4.75 Number of cut points of attribute 2 : 2 Cut point 0 of attribute 3 : 0.75 Cut point 1 of attribute 3 : 1.75 Number of cut points of attribute 3 : 2
